name: places/ChIJvQEAAItYwokRdSwCoe_ZP68
formattedAddress: 200 W 67th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 200 W 67th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: I would not say that this is a luxury apartment. First of all, this is a renovated building with a relatively poor furnishing style inside the building even if it looks luxurious outside. The gym was small and the terrace was barren. Second, the move-in fee and non-refundable elevator fee are absurd. Nearly only a few apartments require that fee and I don't think the environment of Aire is worthy for me to hand it that fee. Third, when I did the room tour of different units, nearly all the units were dirty and messy and it seemed that I entered a room that someone had just moved out yesterday and hadn't had time to clean it up yet. I just think the cleaning team of this building is so irresponsible and they don't really care how important it is for a customer to inspect a room with cleanliness and tidiness. Lastly, the price of the apartment is not reasonable, one could spend the same amount of money getting another luxury apartment that is way more nice and big than that.

originalText.text: My dad lived here for 3 years until his death recently. When I got the security deposit check there was $150 missing but no information given as to why. I called to ask, and was told that since my dad moved in on November 30, 2020 but the lease began on December 1, they decided .. 3 full years later .. that we had used an extra day and to charge $150 for it. When I moved out - I actually turned the key over to the front desk 10 days before the lease was up .. but apparently those 10 days the apartment was empty and returned early did not matter in the face of this one day from 3 years ago that’s being brought up now. Just leaving my experience here as it felt distasteful to me

originalText.text: Good but heating and AC systems are the worst. Constantly sick and management doesn’t fix. They literally control the temperature of your apartment so it’s either extremely cold or extremely hot and there’s nothing you can do. Filters are always dusty

text.text: Good but heating and AC systems are the worst. Constantly sick and management doesn’t fix. They literally control the temperature of your apartment so it’s either extremely cold or extremely hot and there’s nothing you can do. Filters are always dusty

originalText.text:
I moved to Aire in 2021. The majestic height & beautiful driveway lured me in. The compliments end here. From indifferent leasing staff to property management my Aire experience was extremely bad. Some of many issues:
-Leasing office staff is impersonal & rather rude
-my apartment was delivered to me very dirty. It needed a deep cleaning.
-I woke up my first morning very sick. Resident manager sent a porter to clean the HVACs which were filthy.
-Later when the heat was turned on I began to get sick again. Property management was very uncooperative so I paid $1000 to get an air quality test. The results showed traces of formaldehyde. Management continued to be difficult but finally sent a company to clean the HVACs. The technician said all were filthy dirty especially the bedroom & dining room.
The company said they were sending better quality filters but I never received them. I bought my own hepa filters. When I asked management about them they ignored me.
-in January the property manager began harassing me to allow their company to do an air quality test. He never asked how I was doing. I acquiesced but never understood his rationale because the HVACs had been cleaned.
-the apt was constantly dusty. I dusted everyday. If I wore black clothing inside the apt it would be covered in lint. Many times large lint balls were on the floor.
-the washing machine & dryer ruined a few articles of clothing. Both seemed infested with dust.
-I discovered Bona rags behind the refrigerator.
-the toilet water continuously stained the toilet.
-the bathroom & kitchen vents were filthy. Management sent a porter to clean them.
-the kitchen faucet was in horrid condition. They finally replaced it.
-kitchen floor had unsightly stains. A company attempted to clean to no avail.
-elevators were constantly out of order. Allow time when you leave.
-the trash room smelled 24/7 & the odor escaped into the hallways & down to the valet level.

I could go on but I’ll stop by saying I am once again happy & healthy.
Stay away from Aire-don’t be fooled by its architectural beauty.

originalText.text: The neighborhood is great! and the leasing team works really good.  I was very happy to work with Olivia. She is a very helpful and nice agent. As soon as I contacted her she made few video tours for me with the best available options in this building. She also gave me the information about all available concessions and we tried to get the best deal for me. Because of some circumstances I didn't rent the place. I really recommend this building for people who wants to live in the best part of upper west site
